{}.response: Please provide at least one genre to search for movies. The API 'Search by Genre' requires a genre parameter to filter and return relevant movie details. The accepted input should specify the genre of movies you are interested in. For example, you can input genres such as 'Action', 'Comedy', 'Drama', 'Thriller', etc. Without a specific genre to search for, the API cannot process your request and provide a list of movies. Ensure your request includes a key-value pair with key 'genre' and a value representing the genre of movies you wish to discover.

{'genre': 'Action'}.response:
You searched for movies in the 'Action' genre. Below is a list of action movies along with some brief details. Please note that this is not an exhaustive list, and there are many more action movies that can be discovered using our service.

1. 'Mad Max: Fury Road' - Directed by George Miller, this intense high-octane film takes place in a post-apocalyptic wasteland where Max teams up with Furiosa to escape from a warlord and his army.

2. 'Die Hard' - A classic action film where NYPD officer John McClane takes on a group of terrorists who have taken hostages in a Los Angeles skyscraper during a Christmas party. Directed by John McTiernan.

3. 'The Dark Knight' - Directed by Christopher Nolan, this film follows Batman as he contends with the Joker, a villain who wishes to create anarchy in Gotham City. Christian Bale stars as Batman, with Heath Ledger delivering an iconic performance as the Joker.

4. 'John Wick' - Starring Keanu Reeves as the titular character, this movie depicts a retired hitman seeking vengeance for the death of his beloved dog, given to him by his late wife.

5. 'The Avengers' - Directed by Joss Whedon, this ensemble superhero movie features iconic Marvel characters like Iron Man, Captain America, and Thor joining forces to save the planet from threats beyond the capacity of any single hero.Each movie in this list epitomizes the action genre with their respective high stakes, adrenaline-pumping sequences, and dynamic characters. To get more details or discover more action movies, you can refine your search or explore other genres according to your interest.

Here is a list of popular action movies that fall under the genre ID 28: 

1. 'Mad Max: Fury Road' (2015) - In a post-apocalyptic world, Max teams up with Furiosa to flee from cult leader Immortan Joe and his army, leading to a high-speed road war. 

2. 'John Wick' (2014) - A retired hitman seeks vengeance for the killing of his dog, a gift from his late wife, triggering an all-out war with a New York mob boss. 

3. 'The Dark Knight' (2008) - Batman, Gordon, and Harvey Dent are forced to deal with the chaos unleashed by an anarchist mastermind known only as the Joker, as it drives each of them to their limits. 

4. 'Die Hard' (1988) - NYPD officer John McClane's Christmas holiday turns into a struggle for survival after a group of terrorists take hostages in an LA skyscraper. 

5. 'Inception' (2010) - A skilled thief uses dream-sharing technology to infiltrate the subconscious and is offered a chance to regain his old life in exchange for planting an idea in a target's mind. 

6. 'The Avengers' (2012) - Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.

{'genre_id': 12}.response:
Upon querying with genre_id 12, a selection of Adventure films have been discovered from our comprehensive movie database. These movies vary widely, encompassing classic swashbuckling adventures, epic sagas set in distant landscapes, and modern high-stakes exploits. Below are details for a sampling of films within this exhilarating genre:

1. 'Raiders of the Lost Ark' (1981) - Directed by Steven Spielberg, this iconic film stars Harrison Ford as the intrepid archaeologist Indiana Jones. The movie combines action, historical mysteries, and a touch of supernatural elements, as Indy races against Nazis to find the Ark of the Covenant.

2. 'The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring' (2001) - A masterpiece directed by Peter Jackson, this epic adventure is the first in the trilogy based on the novels by J.R.R. Tolkien. It follows a group of heroes who embark on a quest to destroy the One Ring, which has the power to control all other rings and decides the fate of Middle Earth.

3. 'Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl' (2003) - This film directed by Gore Verbinski is a blend of adventure, fantasy, and comedy. With Johnny Depp as the unforgettable Captain Jack Sparrow, the movie follows a group of pirates who seek to lift a curse that has condemned them to live as the undead.

Other notable Adventure movies spanning various decades and styles also include 'The Goonies' (1985), 'Jurassic Park' (1993), 'The Mummy' (1999), and more recent installments like 'Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle' (2017). This genre is known for its ability to transport audiences to extraordinary worlds and present thrilling heroics, and each of these films demonstrates the endless possibilities within the realm of Adventure cinema.

For complete details on each movie, including cast, crew, plot summaries, and audience ratings, please access the detailed movie information through our movie details API or visit our web platform. Note that availability may vary by region and is subject to our database's current offerings.

{'genre_id': 16}.response:
The 'Search by Genre' API has successfully processed your input for genre id 16, which typically corresponds to the 'Animation' genre in most movie databases. Below is a list of popular animated movies that match your search criteria along with their details:

1. 'Toy Story' - Directed by John Lasseter, this groundbreaking film was released in 1995 and became a beloved classic for both children and adults. It follows the story of a group of toys that come to life when humans aren't around.

2. 'Finding Nemo' - A 2003 animated adventure directed by Andrew Stanton, it tells the heartwarming tale of a clownfish named Marlin who, with the help of a forgetful fish named Dory, searches the ocean for his missing son Nemo.

3. 'Spirited Away' - Directed by Hayao Miyazaki and released in 2001, this Japanese animated fantasy film has been acclaimed for its storyline and artistry. It revolves around a young girl navigating a world of spirits and gods after her parents are transformed into pigs.

4. 'The Incredibles' - A 2004 action-packed animated film by director Brad Bird. It centers around a family of superheroes who must hide their powers and live a quiet suburban life but are drawn back into action to save the world.

5. 'Up' - Directed by Pete Docter, this 2009 movie takes audiences on an emotional journey with an elderly widower who attaches balloons to his house to fly to South America, accompanied by an eager young scout.

These movies are known for their high-quality animation, storytelling, and appeal to a wide range of audiences. Note that the availability and specific details of these movies can vary depending on your location and the movie database you are accessing. This curated list includes only a small sample of the vast array of animated films that fall under genre id 16. For a complete and personalized list of animated movies, you might consider using additional filters such as release year, director, cast, or ratings.
